feedback.Physical object: Included — A tangible item consisting of solar panels, casing, and connectors.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Engineered and assembled using synthetic materials like silicon, polymers, and metal.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — No modeling on biological systems, even if conceptually reminiscent of photosynthesis.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Operates from a stationary position while in use (mounted or positioned for sun exposure).
feedback.Structural: Included — Frame, cell layout, and orientation determine performance.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Designed to be positioned and observed by the user.
feedback.Material form: Included — A physical apparatus built from durable materials.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — Converts solar energy to electrical output — an active energy transformation process.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Created for the explicit function of charging batteries or devices using solar energy.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Generates and delivers electrical current.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — Basic models lack logical control or signal interpretation.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Included — Converts light energy into electrical energy; may involve tracking or storing charge.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Typically has no interactive interface or real-time feedback.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — Can integrate with batteries, microgrids, or portable power banks.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Included — Functions automatically when exposed to sunlight, requiring no further user input.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — May be important contextually, but not inherently critical to broader system operation.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Not designed to convey symbols or meaning.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not emit or receive coded communication.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Function is physically governed, not logically encoded.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Typically a monolithic system without conceptual subsystems.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Does not instruct or influence user behavior semantically.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — No reflective or modeling capability.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Depends on time of day and duration of sunlight exposure for performance.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Function remains consistent regardless of symbolic or cultural context.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Grounded in physical utility, not cultural framing.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — May be standardized, but not semantically defined by groups.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Regulation may apply, but is not intrinsic to the object’s function.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Use can be taught, but that’s not a defining trait.
feedback.Visible: Included — Often positioned in sunlight-exposed areas, visibility is intentional.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Function doesn’t vary semantically with setting.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Recognized globally as a sustainable energy solution.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats the solar charger as a physical, autonomous energy transformation device with a time-dependent function and broad public familiarity. Logical, symbolic, or socially defined traits are excluded, reflecting the charger's grounded, passive-operating design.
